questions.question: Follow the directions ……………………… or this medicine may be harmful.
questions.description: Carefully is an adverb. We use an adverb to modify verbs. Here it modifies the verb follow.

questions.question: One has to be ……………………. to work as a lumberjack.
After that ……………………….. experience I shook for a week.
questions.description: The present participle is used to talk about the people or things that cause those feelings.

questions.question: The harsh light ………………………. my eyes.
questions.description: Hurt is the present and past simple form of hurt.

questions.question: There wasn’t much time so I dressed ………………………
A ……………………… search turned up the missing earring.
questions.description: Hasty is an adjective hastily is an adverb. We need an adjective here.

questions.question: She isn’t ………………………. to be a good dancer.
questions.description: Enough goes after the adjective modified by it.

questions.question: The queen received her subjects in a ……………………….. manner.
He knew ……………………….. well what I was trying to say.
questions.description: Full can also be used as an adverb.

questions.question: He speaks too ………………….. to be heard.
questions.description: We need the adverb softly to modify the verb speaks.

questions.question: It was ……………………. a case of mistaken identity.
